Seems like this was broken between `0.9.2` and `0.9.3`.

I'm not at all familiar with this code base, so please let me know if there is a better way to do this. That said, this compiles and unblocks my project locally.

body: The example in the README.md is outdated and not working. This PR updates it to match the working example in the documentation.

title: Update hashbrown requirement from 0.5.0 to 0.6.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Updates the requirements on [hashbrown](https://github.com/rust-lang/hashbrown) to permit the latest version.
Changelog *Sourced from [hashbrown's changelog](https://github.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).* > ## [v0.6.0] - 2019-08-13 > > ### Fixed > - Fixed AHash accidentally depending on `std`. ([#110](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/issues/110)) > > ### Changed > - The minimum Rust version has been bumped to 1.32 (due to `rand` dependency). > > ## ~~[v0.5.1] - 2019-08-04~~ > > This release was _yanked_ due to a breaking change for users of `no-default-features`. > > ### Added > - The experimental and unsafe `RawTable` API is available under the "raw" feature. ([#108](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/issues/108)) > - Added entry-like methods for `HashSet`. ([#98](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/issues/98)) > > ### Changed > - Changed the default hasher from FxHash to AHash. ([#97](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/issues/97)) > - `hashbrown` is now fully `no_std` on recent Rust versions (1.36+). ([#96](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/issues/96)) > > ### Fixed > - We now avoid growing the table during insertions when it wasn't necessary. ([#106](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/issues/106)) > - `RawOccupiedEntryMut` now properly implements `Send` and `Sync`. ([#100](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/issues/100)) > - Relaxed `lazy_static` version. ([#92](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/issues/92)) > > ## [v0.5.0] - 2019-06-12 > > ### Fixed > - Resize with a more conservative amount of space after deletions. ([#86](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/issues/86)) > > ### Changed > - Exposed the Layout of the failed allocation in CollectionAllocErr::AllocErr. ([#89](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/issues/89)) > > ## [v0.4.0] - 2019-05-30 > > ### Fixed > - Fixed `Send` trait bounds on `IterMut` not matching the libstd one. ([#82](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/issues/82)) > > ## [v0.3.1] - 2019-05-30 > > ### Fixed > - Fixed incorrect use of slice in unsafe code. ([#80](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/issues/80)) > > ## [v0.3.0] - 2019-04-23 > > ### Changed > - Changed shrink_to to not panic if min_capacity < capacity. ([#67](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/issues/67)) > > ### Fixed > - Worked around emscripten bug emscripten-core/emscripten-fastcomp#258. ([#66](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/issues/66)) > ... (truncated)
Commits - [`0a62c3e`](https://github.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/commit/0a62c3ec75ee3d3f039952d8ab218ee021d3a1e4) Version 0.6.0 - [`0c1209a`](https://github.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/commit/0c1209a3ed68f99a6aacb32e8e8421092f3eb7f2) Auto merge of [#110](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/issues/110) - Amanieu:no_std_ci, r=Amanieu - [`8ae33c9`](https://github.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/commit/8ae33c973c1e69e1ba29b089df1eef9878950e05) Don't use cross for thumb target CI - [`3239c2b`](https://github.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/commit/3239c2bf5ede1011df71ad10cfa12352e1a0b560) Fix clippy warnings - [`12c55b6`](https://github.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/commit/12c55b60b21894777b78998151030a7611ea264d) Bump minimum Rust version to 1.32 - [`fb0a938`](https://github.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/commit/fb0a9389150cba1426bf7f731f6f5bac237eda50) Bump minimum ahash version to 0.2.11 - [`bacb169`](https://github.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/commit/bacb169740fe04c6f0734d3b43bc5482de040ab6) Merge pull request [#111](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/issues/111) from RalfJung/readme - [`2921920`](https://github.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/commit/29219206fd9d6a867bc35cd23c50814c13a1848d) when hashers with different design goals are compared, that should be noted - [`aecb361`](https://github.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/commit/aecb3612a1aee00d51e9767956e3927321388318) Check in CI that the crate builds on targets without libstd - [`167eb54`](https://github.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/commit/167eb543d932d11becb40a69456551798e85b07d) Version 0.5.1 - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/rust-lang/hashbrown/compare/v0.5.0...v0.6.0)

title: Improved Documentation of the function `create`
body:
Improved Documentation of the function `create`.

This change explain where the dispatcher come from.

title: Change wording in BatchController and impose Send requirements
body:
Because panicking is general not unsafe, changes the doc comment of `BatchController::create` to better match the doc comment of the trait regarding safety.

As the implementers of the trait are supposed to be `Send` I added the requirement explicitly. 

I am still not sure why `Dispatcher` isn't `Send`, so I am not sure about the safety considerations.

title: Implemented batch dispatching
body:
This is the second iteration to implement the Batch dispatching following the feedback received in this PR: https://github.com/slide-rs/shred/pull/144 (Was easier for me redo everything rather change it)

This is the project to test this feature: 
[shred_test.zip](https://github.com/slide-rs/shred/files/3363344/shred_test.zip)

title: Print type name for cell borrow errors
body: Fixes #140

title: Move methods from `specs::WorldExt` to `World`
body: Also bumped to 0.9.0 due to recent breaking change (#138).

title: Remove box indirection in `Fetch{,Mut}`
body:
I know that `cell` is a small part of this library that is not really meant for consumption. However upon closer inspection, in my process to learn amethyst, I figured that I might have a change that could cause a tiny performance improvement that hopefully would ripple through-out all consumers of this library. 

## Situation

The existing implementation of `Ref{,Mut}` had the implicit bound `T: Sized`. However internally the `T` was stored behind a reference, which means that it doesn't need to be sized to make `Ref{,Mut}` a sized struct. By removing this bound we can make `T` a `dyn Resource` instead of a `Box<Resource>`, which means that we remove a layer of indirection. This means that instead of having a `Fetch{,Mut}` with a `Ref{,Mut}<'_, Box<Resource>>`, we can rather give it `Ref{,Mut}<'_, dyn Resource>`.

## Solution

To accomplish this I defined `map` on `Ref{,Mut}` (as is implemented in std for `Ref{,Mut}` of `RefCell`) so that one could modify the contents of `Ref{,Mut}`. That way one can work around the fact that the `T` in `TrustCell` has to be sized, by rather changing the reference after it's creation. 

## Performance

I ran the benchmarks in the repo to see a small performance _increase_ in the `basic` case. 

##### Box-indirection (before)

```
test basic          ... bench:       9,152 ns/iter (+/- 90)
test bench_fetching ... bench:       4,602 ns/iter (+/- 7)
```

##### Direct reference (after)

```
test basic                  ... bench:       8,510 ns/iter (+/- 60)
test bench_fetching         ... bench:       4,608 ns/iter (+/- 95)
```

----

Further I added two benchmarks which also highlight the difference.

##### Comparison when accessing value of Ref multiple times

```
test bench_direct_refs      ... bench:       5,010 ns/iter (+/- 50)
test bench_indirection_refs ... bench:       6,618 ns/iter (+/- 182)
```

title: Remove bound from documentation
body: The docs mention that `Debug` has to be implemented for a type for it to be a resource, but in code the bound is only `Any + Send + Sync`. Is this change correct? :smile:

body:
Updates the requirements on [hashbrown](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown) to permit the latest version.
Changelog *Sourced from [hashbrown's changelog](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).* > ## [v0.3.0] - 2019-04-23 > > ### Changed > - Changed shrink_to to not panic if min_capacity < capacity. ([#67](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/67)) > > ### Fixed > - Worked around emscripten bug emscripten-core/emscripten-fastcomp#258. ([#66](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/66)) > > ## [v0.2.2] - 2019-04-16 > > ### Fixed > - Inlined non-nightly lowest_set_bit_nonzero. ([#64](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/64)) > - Fixed build on latest nightly. ([#65](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/65)) > > ## [v0.2.1] - 2019-04-14 > > ### Changed > - Use for_each in map Extend and FromIterator. ([#58](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/58)) > - Improved worst-case performance of HashSet.is_subset. ([#61](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/61)) > > ### Fixed > - Removed incorrect debug_assert. ([#60](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/60)) > > ## [v0.2.0] - 2019-03-31 > > ### Changed > - The code has been updated to Rust 2018 edition. This means that the minimum > Rust version has been bumped to 1.31 (2018 edition). > > ### Added > - Added `insert_with_hasher` to the raw_entry API to allow `K: !(Hash + Eq)`. ([#54](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/54)) > - Added support for using hashbrown as the hash table implementation in libstd. ([#46](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/46)) > > ### Fixed > - Fixed cargo build with minimal-versions. ([#45](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/45)) > - Fixed `#[may_dangle]` attributes to match the libstd `HashMap`. ([#46](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/46)) > - ZST keys and values are now handled properly. ([#46](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/46)) > > ## [v0.1.8] - 2019-01-14 > > ### Added > - Rayon parallel iterator support ([#37](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/37)) > - `raw_entry` support ([#31](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/31)) > - `#[may_dangle]` on nightly ([#31](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/31)) > - `try_reserve` support ([#31](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/31)) > > ### Fixed > - Fixed variance on `IterMut`. ([#31](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/31)) > > ## [v0.1.7] - 2018-12-05 > ... (truncated)
Commits - [`7e79b0c`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/7e79b0c33ec434857e46a8ff3d4ece413c21aaba) Version 0.3.0 - [`7e2da14`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/7e2da14d3c22e8034b5639043947350b79e4aef4) Merge [#67](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/67) - [`8ec72d0`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/8ec72d0da20ae6c03efcc41f7c75ae59d5679c58) Change shrink_to to not panic if min_capacity < capacity - [`ddf59a9`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/ddf59a96c58a7c08c14720dd4737f8ce0e1e7f0e) Merge [#66](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/66) - [`6eddbe4`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/6eddbe43aa7f83fccd585f748db05a3e11b50746) Work around emscripten bug emscripten-core/emscripten-fastcomp#258 - [`7dbd666`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/7dbd6668fd70fdcaf080aa1234e90b92f85bd729) Version 0.2.2 - [`12e8bb9`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/12e8bb959796fead8fb395d002b39a4ee451bebf) Merge [#64](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/64) - [`a657af5`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/a657af549dab8aed4e3b01711489ccda0d5ae176) Merge [#65](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/65) - [`373a9d4`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/373a9d4203a90ff0fd8db795132acfc6c591abba) Fix warning on latest nightly - [`79c5b41`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/79c5b41e153e620cfe1f7cdc78a83ad531f1314a) Inline non-nightly lowest_set_bit_nonzero - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/compare/v0.2.0...v0.3.0)

title: Make Fetch cloneable
body: Working on allowing [gluon](https://github.com/gluon-lang/gluon) to work with specs/shred and ended up needing to clone some `Fetch<EntitiesRes>` values. I don't know fully how specs/shred work internally but this should be equivalent to doing multiple `fetch` operations and should therefore be sound.

title: Prepare v0.7.2 and Make dispose self consuming
Rename World::new to World::empty
body:
This allows to avoid confusion with the `WorldExt::new`
from Specs

body:
Updates the requirements on [hashbrown](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown) to permit the latest version.
Changelog *Sourced from [hashbrown's changelog](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).* > ## [v0.2.0] - 2019-03-31 > > ### Changed > - The code has been updated to Rust 2018 edition. This means that the minimum > Rust version has been bumped to 1.31 (2018 edition). > > ### Added > - Added `insert_with_hasher` to the raw_entry API to allow `K: !(Hash + Eq)`. ([#54](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/54)) > - Added support for using hashbrown as the hash table implementation in libstd. ([#46](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/46)) > > ### Fixed > - Fixed cargo build with minimal-versions. ([#45](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/45)) > - Fixed `#[may_dangle]` attributes to match the libstd `HashMap`. ([#46](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/46)) > - ZST keys and values are now handled properly. ([#46](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/46)) > > ## [v0.1.8] - 2019-01-14 > > ### Added > - Rayon parallel iterator support ([#37](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/37)) > - `raw_entry` support ([#31](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/31)) > - `#[may_dangle]` on nightly ([#31](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/31)) > - `try_reserve` support ([#31](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/31)) > > ### Fixed > - Fixed variance on `IterMut`. ([#31](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/31)) > > ## [v0.1.7] - 2018-12-05 > > ### Fixed > - Fixed non-SSE version of convert_special_to_empty_and_full_to_deleted. ([#32](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/32)) > - Fixed overflow in rehash_in_place. ([#33](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/33)) > > ## [v0.1.6] - 2018-11-17 > > ### Fixed > - Fixed compile error on nightly. ([#29](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/29)) > > ## [v0.1.5] - 2018-11-08 > > ### Fixed > - Fixed subtraction overflow in generic::Group::match_byte. ([#28](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/28)) > > ## [v0.1.4] - 2018-11-04 > > ### Fixed > - Fixed a bug in the `erase_no_drop` implementation. ([#26](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/26)) > > ## [v0.1.3] - 2018-11-01 > > ### Added > ... (truncated)
Commits - [`af90bc9`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/af90bc990bd50b63cc697ac3bef0f64a383ba02b) Version 0.2.0 - [`83ce3d5`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/83ce3d5ab782dd7808394d435e7977e68f88325c) Merge [#46](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/46) - [`f9bcc42`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/f9bcc42d9fc2d8ead2d2de076e0b41ed9ea32ee5) Add #[may_dangle] to RawIntoIter - [`b11f8cd`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/b11f8cd9abb1a2c567757d0c1b7a5d46b31a75bd) Upgrade to 2018 edition - [`2bd15ed`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/2bd15ed4c53a02c9f55996632b96552a891fb9e2) Apply feedback from https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/56241 - [`91d3e4a`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/91d3e4af985842348f5c0ae2e84d0e9e5dbd9a9e) Merge [#55](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/55) - [`49a9d6c`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/49a9d6cd80ad3fc8ee09e39d36a7dd891504a812) use --exclude-should-panic - [`c36d49a`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/c36d49aa0f45c06ee8e41843f7745e2f7c78ff16) install Miri via rustup - [`332db4d`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/332db4dd1a6ff07735794fed699b7ecea3da4450) Prepare hashbrown for inclusion in the standard library - [`edf79d0`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/commit/edf79d0bf2fe5fe38fe0f215d1f9982fde1110c6) Merge [#54](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/issues/54) - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown/compare/v0.1.7...v0.2.0)

title: Update cgmath requirement from 0.16 to 0.17

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Updates the requirements on [cgmath](https://github.com/brendanzab/cgmath) to permit the latest version.
Changelog *Sourced from [cgmath's changelog](https://github.com/rustgd/cgmath/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).* > ## [v0.17.0] - 2019-01-17 > > ### Added > > - Add signed `Angle` normalization > > ### Changed > > - Move `lerp()` from `InnerSpace` to `VectorSpace` > - `const` constructors > > ## [v0.16.1] - 2018-03-21 > > ### Added > > - Implement `ElementWise` trait for point types > - Add `map` function to points and vectors > > ### Changed > > - Remove `BaseNum` trait requirement for `PointN::new` functions > > ## [v0.16.0] - 2018-01-03 > > ### Added > > - Add `InnerSpace::project_on` > - Add `Array::len` > - Re-export `Bounded` and implement for vectors, points, and angles > - Add vector subtraction to `EuclideanSpace` > - Add swizzle functions behinde that `"swizzle"` feature > - Add `Matrix4::look_at_dir` > > ### Changed > > - Return `Option` from cast functions > > ## [v0.15.0] - 2017-07-30 > > ### Added > > - Implement `mint` conversions behind a feature > - Add `Quaternion::cast` > > ### Changed > > - Rename `use_simd` feature to `simd` > - Rename `eders` feature to `serde` > > ### Fixed > ... (truncated)
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/brendanzab/cgmath/commits/v0.17.0)

title: Renamed 'Resource' to 'World'
body:
I renamed  'Resource' to 'World'  as stated in [this issue](https://github.com/slide-rs/specs/issues/523).


This PR is part 1 of two PR's described in the linked issue.

title: Update HashMaps to use hashbrown HashMap
body:
A small update of the `FxHashMap` `HashMap` to use the more perfomante `hashbrown` `HashMap`.

[`hashbrown`](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown) is a Rust port of Google's high-performance SwissTable hash map and is around [2 times faster](https://github.com/Amanieu/hashbrown#features) than `FxHashMap`.

title: Remove `::` prefix from derived implementation.
body:
This allows an in-scope re-exported `shred` crate to be used.

Closes #102

---

I'll test this in a larger project, give me a few days to get to it.

title: Updated to `syn 0.15` and `quote 0.6`.
body: Passes existing tests, yay!

title: Fix wrong documentation of ReadExpect
body: Fixes slide-rs/specs#471
